product_name: CliniqueMoisture Surge CC Cream Hydrating Colour Corrector Broad Spectrum SPF 30
summary: SummaryHighlightsSustainable PackagingHSA/FSA eligibleClinique Moisture Surge CC Cream SPF 30 is one simple step for glowing skin. Moisturizes, perfects, and protects with SPF.
details: DetailsBenefitsAll Skin Types.Coverage: Moderate.Finish: Natural.Lightweight formula instantly color corrects a range of complexion concerns - redness, dullness, sallowness - so all you see is a healthy-looking glow.Oil-free hydration and sunscreen mean a more flawless look tomorrow, too.Each versatile shade is appropriate for a range of skin tones and undertones.For lighter coverage, spot-apply CC Cream where skin looks red or dull.For moderate coverage, smooth it on bare skin or mix a little with your moisturizer.For fuller coverage, wear it under foundation.Dermatologist tested.Allergy tested.Formulated WithoutParabensPhthalatesOil-freeNon-acnegenicFragranceItem 2258299How To UseWear it alone or apply it over your favourite Clinique moisturizer (a great option for drier skins). For gentle, efficient removal, use any Clinique makeup remover. Men can wear it too-it blends easily for a healthy look.IngredientsActive: Octinoxate 7.50%, Octisalate 5.00%, Titanium Dioxide 5.20%, Zinc Oxide 3.20%. Inactive: Water / Aqua / Eau, Squalane, Octyldodecyl Neopentanoate, Butylene Glycol, Propanediol, Glyceryl Stearate, Behenyl Alcohol, PEG-40 Stearate, Polyglyceryl-10 Pentastearate, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Water, Thermus Thermophillus Ferment, Trehalose, Caffeine, Glycerin, Linoleic Acid, Lecithin, Stearic Acid, Hydrogenated Lecithin, Sorbitol, Polyglyceryl-6 Polyricinoleate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate / VP Copolymer, Sodium Stearoyl Lactylate, Sodium Hyaluronate, Tetrahexyldecyl Ascorbate, Pentaerythrityl Tetra-Di-T-Butyl Hydroxyhydrocinnamate, Isopropyl Titanium Triisostearate, Synthetic Fluorphlogopite, Xanthan Gum, Silica, Alumina, Sodium Dehydroacetate, Tin Oxide, Disodium EDTA, Phenoxyethanol. May Contain: Mica, Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Iron Oxides (CI 77492), Iron Oxides (CI 77491), Iron Oxides (CI 77499).Please be aware that ingredient lists may change or vary from time to time. Please refer to the ingredient list on the product package you receive for the most up to date list of ingredients.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Wear it alone or apply it over your favourite Clinique moisturizer (a great option for drier skins). For gentle, efficient removal, use any Clinique makeup remover. Men can wear it too-it blends easily for a healthy look.
ingredients: Zinc Oxide 3.20%. Inactive: Water / Aqua / Eau

reviews.headline: Way too greasy, not for me
reviews.comments: I wasn't super convinced by the product in the store, but the salesperson assured me it'd be great and meet the needs I was after -- something lightweight, good for my skin type, and easy to fit into my routine. This is WAY too greasy. Not a fan.

reviews.headline: loved until I saw the color selections
reviews.comments:
It's 2025. It's completely unacceptable to have this shade range from a company with these resources. Won't be purchasing a full size. 
Won't be repurchasing my other Clinique products.

reviews.headline: Great coverage without being heavy.
reviews.comments: I am fair skinned with freckles and I wear medium light in summer and light in winter. makes my skin more evenly toned and its so easy to apply and lasts all day. it's moisturizing and feels like nothing is on your skin. Dewey yet not greasy. buildable and it has spf! It is all I have ever wanted in a "foundation". Thank you Clinique!

reviews.headline: Easy and Good Coverage
reviews.comments: Just blot it with a brush and it looks so natural!

reviews.headline: I would buy this again
reviews.comments: It's moisturizing and has enough coverage for me. The best of it is that it doesn't cause fine lines. Not sure how much the sun protection would be because I usually tends not to stay under the sun for long.

reviews.headline: Sticky and disappointing
reviews.comments: I wanted a correcting cream that would be good for at home days. I liked the color and appearance when I applied it, but it doesn't absorb into the skin and stays sticky on my face.

reviews.headline: will buy again
reviews.comments: Have used Clinique for over 30 years.

reviews.headline: Good light and correcting foundation with SPF
reviews.comments: I've recently purchased and really like its lightweight consistency and color correcting features. I have the medium color and works nicely even with my oily t-zone combo skin. I felt that my skin looked too shiny around my t-zone (glowy), so I added concealer under my eyes and on both sides of my nose, and it was perfectly long lasting and the right tones. I'm using this for coverage during the week where I want light, natural looking face and not too heavy on the makeup. I found no excessive oiliness during the day and it had very good staying ability. Would recommend for anyone with oily or combo/oily skin.

reviews.headline: Highlights every pore like a spot light
reviews.comments: This doesnt blend well. I was really determined to figure it out, but nothing I do helps and it just sits in my pores, which are not normally visible until I put the cream on.

reviews.headline: Thicker consistency than I hoped
reviews.comments: I have been looking for a tinted moisturizer with SPF so I tried this one. Definitely thicker than a tinted moisturizer and comes off more like foundation. I found it thick to apply and difficult to spread on my face with my fingers (even after applying moisturizer). The color match was okay, but not great. I tried the light shade and I have light neutral skin.

reviews.headline: I would buy this product again
reviews.comments: It matched my skin tone perfectly. You couldn't even tell that I was wearing it.

reviews.headline: The best cc cream I've used
reviews.comments: This cc cream is extremely light weight and moisturzing. I have gotten tons of compliments with this on my skin. It is your skin, but better. I set this with the brightebing morphe powder and it creates a great light weight low make up look!

reviews.headline: I love this CC
reviews.comments: Nice coverage, lightweight.  I don't even know I have it on unless I look in the mirror.

reviews.headline: Love it
reviews.comments: It is so lightweight. I wear it everyday

reviews.headline: I use only this foundation.
reviews.comments: Feels so good and covers so well.

reviews.headline: In love
reviews.comments: I have extremely dry skin. I have been searching for way too long trying to find something that doesn't get flaky or patchy on my face. This is it. I put it on for work, 10+ hours later I look in the mirror and my face looks ALIVE I love.

reviews.headline: nice coverage
reviews.comments: I bought this because I needed a foundation that wasn't heavy.  The coverage is nice but so is the built in hydration and sunscreen.  I am really enjoying it and evens my skin tone.

reviews.headline: love the natural look
reviews.comments: thick formula, little goes a long way. love not using a heavy foundation! amd the spf is spot on.

reviews.headline: love the natural look
reviews.comments: thick formula, little goes a long way. love not using a heavy foundation! amd the spf is spot on.

reviews.headline: Not for me
reviews.comments: I was recommended this when my Ulta location was out of my normal tinted sunscreen which is PTR. It was just too heavy and like makeup when I just wanted sun protection with a light tint. Not for me. Returned and bought my usual sunscreen.

faceoff_positive.comments: I have been waiting for a CC Cream from Clinique and then voila! My friend let me borrow her early preview and it was the change i needed to remove 20-minutes out of my makeup routine. No more concealer and foundation and uneven frustration every morning. wow!
faceoff_positive.headline: This changed my routine!

faceoff_negative.comments:
With great hopefulness, I try all new Clinique foundations, and usually they are too orange for me, but this one (very light) was a good match for my skin. (In brands with a wide range of shades I am usually the second lightest on the spectrum). This is my first CC cream and I was a little hesitant to get a "moisture surge" product this time of year as they are usually too heavy for me . However, this did not go on like moisturizer at all; it was rather thick and hard to blend. I used a blending sponge like I would for a medium/ full coverage foundation (which I never wear).

It looks good in the bathroom mirror a few feet away, but close up I can see every single pore of my face highlighted -- my nose was the worst, but everywhere it looked like tiny dots. Maybe it's the zinc oxide? So I haven't even had the nerve to wear it out; who knows what it would look like in sunlight/office lights. I have been using retinoids, so that may be why this doesn't "take" to my skin, but unfortunately it didn't work for me. I will try it again in the height of summer and see how it goes, but I suspect it will just make me break out.
faceoff_negative.headline: surprisingly heavy

rollup.name: Moisture Surge CC Cream Hydrating Colour Corrector Broad Spectrum SPF 30
